variant.question: The longitudinal separation minima based on DME, and each aircraft 'on track' uses DME stations, is

options.text: 10 NM provided that the leading aircraft maintains a true airspeed of 20 kts or more faster than the succeeding aircraft.
10 NM provided that the leading aircraft maintains a true airspeed of 40 kts or more faster than the succeeding aircraft.
20 NM provided that the leading aircraft maintains a true airspeed of 10 kts or more faster than the succeeding aircraft.
10 NM provided that the leading aircraft maintains a true airspeed of 10 kts or more faster than the succeeding aircraft.

variant.question: Traffic to which the provision of ATC is applicable

What is the minimum obstacle clearance at the departure end of runway on an instrument departure?
Which answer best applies to the Final Approach Fix (FAF)?

options.text: The optimum distance for locating the FAF from the runway threshold is 5NM.
It signifies the end of the Initial Approach Segment
It signifies the end of the Arrival segment
It signifies the end of the Final Approach Segment

variant.question: Track guidance is provided within ___ for turning departures.

The longitudinal separation minima between aircraft departed from the same aerodrome and following the same track, and the preceding aircraft is maintaining a true airspeed of 20 kts or more faster than the succeeding aircraft, is

In accordance with DOC **4444** (ICAO) when a MEDIUM and a LIGHT aircraft are using the same runway (Light following a Medium), or parallel runways separated by less than 760 m, (in approach or departure phases of flight), shall be applied a wake turbulence radar separation minima of:

"ESSENTIAL TRAFFIC" is that controlled flight to which the provision of separation by ATC is applicable, but which, in relation to a particular controlled flight is not separated therefore by the appropriate separation minima. Whenever separation minima is not applied, the following flights are considered essential traffic one to each other:

options.text: All IFR flight in controlled airspaces and controlled VFR.
Controlled VFR flights and VFR flights.

variant.question: Wake turbulence Separation - departing aircraft . A minimum separation of at least 2 minutes shall be applied between a LIGHT or MEDIUM aircraft and a HEAVY aircraft taking off behind, using parallel runways...

options.text: having a downslope of more than 1.5 degrees in the direction of departure.
having an upslope of more than 1.5 degrees in the direction of departure.

variant.question: Two minute take-off separation may be used between departing aircraft if they are to fly on the same track, when:

options.text: the preceding aircraft is 40 kts or more faster than the following aircraft.
the preceding aircraft is 30 kts or more faster than the following aircraft.
the preceding aircraft is 10 kts or more faster than the following aircraft.
the preceding aircraft is 20 kts or more faster than the following aircraft.

variant.question: A pilot requesting to pass through the level of another aircraft on the same track shall expect instructions..

options.text: allowing minimum longitudinal separation based on time.
to carry out a base turn.
to carry out a procedure turn.
allowing minimum longitudinal separation based on distance.

variant.question: 'Essential Traffic' is

options.text: controlled traffic not separated from another controlled traffic with the prescribed separation minima.
uncontrolled IFR flights separated from uncontrolled VFR flights within advisory airspace.
controlled traffic separated from other controlled traffic with the prescribed separation minima.
controlled IFR flights separated from uncontrolled flights within advisory airspace.

variant.question: For controlled traffic that shall be separated in the vicinity of an airport, separation minima may be reduced

options.text: when the commander in the following aircraft has the preceding aircraft in sight and is able to maintain own separation.
at the discretion of the air traffic controller.
if the commander of the involved aircraft so requests.
only if the air traffic controller has the involved aircraft in sight.

variant.question: A request for a ??clearance to maintain own separation while in VMC may be granted by the appropriate ATS authorityPilots of other involved aircraft have to agree to the request The conditions necessary for the request to be granted are

options.text: Airspace Class D and E, VMC, and hours of daylight.
Airspace Class C, VMC, and hours of daylight.
Airspace Class C and D, and VMC.
Airspace Class B, C, D and E, and VMC.

options.text: 15 minutes at the time the level is crossed.
10 minutes at the time the level is crossed.
20 minutes at the time the level is crossed.
5 minutes at the time the level is crossed.

variant.question: Can the separation between two aircraft be further reduced than the minimum separation?

options.text: Yes, in certain situations the minimum separation can be further reduced.
Yes, at the discretion of the pilot or ATC

variant.question: Can the separation between two aircraft be further reduced than the minimum separation?

options.text: Yes, in certain situations the minimum separation can be further reduced.
Yes, at the discretion of the pilot or ATC.

variant.question: For purpose of wake turbulence separation, what is the ICAO minimum radar separation distance and minimum time if a MEDIUM aeroplane (less than 136 000 kg and more than 7 000 kg) is following directly behind a HEAVY aeroplane on the approach to the same runway?

options.text: until 5 minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the instrument runway.
until 3 minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the instrument runway.
until 10 minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the instrument runway.
until 2 minutes before the arriving aircraft is estimated to be over the instrument runway.

variant.question: What is the shortest distance in a sequence for landing between a HEAVY aircraft preceding a LIGHT aircraft?
According to DOC **4444** (ICAO), a wake turbulence radar separation minima of 9.3 km (5.0 NM) shall be applied when a:

options.text: LIGHT aircraft is crossing behind a MEDIUM aircraft, at the same altitude or less than 300 m (1 000 ft).
MEDIUM aircraft is crossing behind a MEDIUM aircraft, at the same altitude or less than 300 m (1 000 ft).
HEAVY aircraft is crossing behind a HEAVY aircraft, at the same altitude or less than 300 m (1 000 ft).
LIGHT aircraft is crossing behind a HEAVY aircraft, at the same altitude or less than 300 m (1 000 ft).

variant.question: In order to meet wake turbulence criteria, for arriving aircraft and using timed approaches, what minima shall be applied to aircraft landing behind a HEAVY or a MEDIUM aircraft?

options.text: MEDIUM aircraft behind HEAVY aircraft - 2 minutes.
LIGHT aircraft behind MEDIUM aircraft - 4 minutes.
MEDIUM aircraft behind other MEDIUM aircraft - 2 minutes.
MEDIUM aircraft behind HEAVY aircraft - 3 minutes.
